definition: lit. to set up a stall on the ground/fig. to start up a new business
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Where is Kunming fit to set up a stall?
Stalls, when setting up, would cause pollution to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 擺地攤過程中會給環境造成污染。

sentences.english: Have you seen the award-winning actor in the street sets up a stall?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾看到金馬獎影帝在街邊擺地攤？

sentences.english: Did you ever see golden horse awards for best actor in street put stall in?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾看到金馬獎影帝在街邊擺地攤？

sentences.english: If his home is better, who would put stall in the cold night.
sentences.chinese: 家境哪怕好一點，誰會大冷天夜裏擺地攤。

definition: way of doing sth/the right social connection
street stall with goods laid out on the ground
to quit one's job (without having another one)
Huicheng district of Huizhou city 惠州市[Hui4 zhou1 shi4], Guangdong
to do hard physical labor (as a job)/(fig.) to play mahjong
